title: Mini Projects with Combined Concepts
concept: Final level. These problems combine loops, arrays, strings, sets and map-like logic into mini-project style tasks, adapted from advanced Snakify problems.

challenges.title: 8 Queens Check
challenges.description: On a chessboard, 8 queens are placed (one per line with coordinates x y). Determine whether any two queens attack each other. Print NO if no pair of queens can attack each other, otherwise print YES.
challenges.inputDescription: 8 lines, each with two integers x and y (1..8).
examples: Example based on Snakify '8 queens' problem.

challenges.title: Bowling Pins
challenges.description: There are N pins initially standing (1..N). Then K balls are rolled; each ball knocks down pins from l to r (inclusive). After all rolls, print a string of length N where 'I' means a pin left standing and '.' means knocked down.
challenges.inputDescription: Two integers N and K, then K lines: l r for each roll.
challenges.outputDescription: String of length N with 'I' and '.'.
examples: Example: N=10, K=1, roll 3 6 -> I I . . . . I I I I

challenges.title: Guessing Game Helper
challenges.description: Augustus thinks of a number from 1 to n. Beatrice gives sets of numbers and Augustus answers YES if his number is in the set, NO otherwise. When Beatrice prints HELP, output all possible numbers Augustus could have chosen.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: integer n. Following lines: either a line of numbers (a guess set) and then 'YES' or 'NO' on next line, or a single word HELP.
challenges.outputDescription: Numbers that could still be the secret, separated by spaces.
examples: Example based on Snakify 'Guess the number' helper problem.

challenges.title: Languages at School
challenges.description: Each student speaks some languages. Determine which languages are spoken by all students and which by at least one student. Print first: count of languages spoken by all students and their names sorted; then count of languages spoken by at least one student and their names sorted.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N (number of students). For each student: integer k, then k lines with language names.
challenges.outputDescription: Two blocks: common languages, then union languages.

challenges.title: Text Word Previous Count
challenges.description: The text is given in a single line. For each word, print the number of its occurrences before it. Words are separated by spaces (punctuation is part of word).
challenges.outputDescription: For each word, an integer on same line separated by spaces.
examples:
Input:
one two one two two

Output:
0 0 1 1 2

challenges.title: Word Occurrence Ordering
challenges.description: Given n lines of text, print all words sorted first by descending frequency, then lexicographically. Words are sequences of non-space characters.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer n followed by n lines.
challenges.outputDescription: One word per line in sorted order.
examples: Same logic as word frequency problem, but as a full mini-task.

challenges.title: Fibonacci Index
challenges.description: Given an integer a, determine its index in the Fibonacci sequence (0-based). If a is not a Fibonacci number, print -1.
challenges.outputDescription: Index n where fib(n) = a, or -1.

challenges.title: Second Largest in Sequence
challenges.description: The sequence consists of distinct positive integers and ends with 0. Determine the value of the second largest element.
challenges.inputDescription: Integers, one per line, ending with 0.

challenges.title: Sequence Statistics
challenges.description: Given a sequence of integers ending with 0, compute and print: total sum, largest element, number of even elements, and number of elements equal to the largest element. Each value on its own line.
challenges.outputDescription: Four lines: sum, max, evenCount, countMax.
examples: Example only; uses combined sequence properties from Snakify tasks.

challenges.title: Latin-English Dictionary Builder
challenges.description: Same as level 9 dictionary inversion, but treat this as a full mini-project: read English-Latin dictionary and build Latin-English dictionary, printing with strict formatting and sorted order.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N, then N lines with 'english - latin1,latin2,...'.
challenges.outputDescription: Latin-English dictionary with each line 'latin - english1,english2,...'.
